etymology.description: 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands") + 十(十) (shí, "ten") = plants rising from the ground -> plant
etymology.interpretation: The character 卉(卉) (huì, "plant") combines 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands") and 十(十) (shí, "ten") to represent a cluster of plants emerging from the earth, evoking the idea of many plants or vegetation.

examples.chinese: 花卉盛开时(花卉盛開時)，令人心旷神怡(令人心曠神怡)。
examples.pinyin: Huā huì shèng kāi shí, lìng rén xīn kuàng shén yí.
examples.english: When the flowering plants bloom, they instill a sense of serenity.

examples.chinese: 各种卉点缀庭院(各種卉點綴庭院)，让环境充满生机(讓環境充滿生機)。
examples.pinyin: Gè zhǒng huì diǎn zhuì tíng yuàn, ràng huán jìng chōng mǎn shēng jī.
examples.english: Various plants adorn the courtyard, making the environment full of vitality.
